job_description: Ledcor is seeking New Graduates and co-op students for positions starting in May, as Project Coordinators in various locations across Canada. The Project Coordinator, under direction and guidance, provides technical and/or management support and assists operations staff to ensure projects are completed on time and within budget.Responsibilities:• Implements and maintains Ledcor systems and procedures at project start-up Performs general administrative and recordkeeping functions• Supports the (sub) contract management process• Manages the change order process and administers the change management process accordingly• Facilitates the tracking of project milestones and financial deadlines and reviews with Project Manager/Superintendent• Facilitates the review and distribution of drawings by following up with the trades/consultants and maintains the drawing log and drawing/sample transmittals• Coordinates the request for information (RFI) process, ensures RFIs are distributed to affected trades and maintains RFI logs and binders• Prepares purchase requisitions for approval and assists with procurement of materials and equipment• Organizes project close-out  including creating turnover documents and assisting in demobilizing the site and archiving documentation
job_requirements: • Must be working toward a post-secondary education in Civil, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering with an interest in Construction • 0 to 2 years related work experience or combination of relevant education and experience• Able to read and understand construction documents• Strong computer background including experience with MS Word, Excel, and scheduling software• Strong communication skills, confident interacting with key contacts in verbal, written and electronic form• Knowledge of office processes: project set up; subcontract management; change orders; RFIs (request for information); lien holdbacks; closeout• Capable of responding to standard internal or external client requests• Ability to solve problems based on clearly defined procedures• Capable of proactively participating in discussions, asking questions, ensuring understanding and provides explanations clearly and precisely• Willingness to work co-operatively with others to achieve team goals and objectives• Familiar with mining/heavy civil/infrastructure construction methodology and practicesOther Details:• Site based role, rotational shift will be assigned• Camp Accommodations or Living Out Allowance provided• Flights provided Open To All Majors:No
